meanings.definition: Avoids by moving quickly out of the way.
meanings.sent1: The cat dodges the dog by jumping to the side.
meanings.sent2: She dodges the rain by running under the shelter.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox dodges the hunter by hiding in the bushes.
meanings.sent4: He dodges the question by changing the topic skillfully.
meanings.sent5: The ninja dodges the enemy's attack with swift movements.

meanings.sent1: The magician dodges the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent2: She dodges her friend by pretending to be busy.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child dodges his sister by hiding behind the door.
meanings.sent4: He dodges his responsibilities by making excuses.
meanings.sent5: The con artist dodges the law by constantly changing identities.

meanings.sent1: Her dodges were so quick that she avoided the flying ball easily.
meanings.sent2: The player's dodges on the field impressed the coach.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's dodges to avoid the falling acorns were amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: His dodges in the dance routine added flair to the performance.
meanings.sent5: The boxer's dodges were like poetry in motion, graceful and effective.
